meanings.sent1: The old teddy bear looked even scruffier after years of being hugged tightly.
meanings.sent2: The stray cat was much scruffier than the pampered house cat.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, Tom always ended up looking scruffier than his classmates.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house on the corner appeared even scruffier in the dim moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The scruffier the dog, the more love it seemed to receive from the kind-hearted children.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or unkempt quality
meanings.sent1: The rough path through the forest became even scruffier after the storm.
meanings.sent2: Her hair looked scruffier than usual after a day of playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The scruffier the blanket, the cozier it felt on the chilly evening.
meanings.sent4: The old book had a scruffier cover compared to the shiny new ones on the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The scruffier the rope, the more challenging it was to climb up the tree.
